intro: Halimocnemis gibbosa, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, showcasing a low-growing, cushion-like form to conserve moisture. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters, contributing to its ecological role in stabilizing sandy environments. Halimocnemis gibbosa is adapted to withstand extreme heat and drought, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
